intro: Pterocaulon spicatum, commonly known as the spicate pterocaulon, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a rough, hairy texture. The flowers are usually pink or purple, and they bloom in spring or early summer.
